trans-unit.source: Displays images in a collection, such as photos in an album or items in a product details page, one image at a time.
trans-unit.target: Displays images in a collection, such as photos in an album or items in a product details page, one image at a time.

trans-unit.source: Guidelines for flip view controls
trans-unit.target: Guidelines for flip view controls

trans-unit.source: Flip view
trans-unit.target: Flip view

trans-unit.source: Use a flip view for browsing images or other items in a collection, such as photos in an album or items in a product details page, one item at a time.
trans-unit.target: Use a flip view for browsing images or other items in a collection, such as photos in an album or items in a product details page, one item at a time.

trans-unit.source: For touch devices, swiping across an item moves through the collection.
trans-unit.target: For touch devices, swiping across an item moves through the collection.

trans-unit.source: For a mouse, navigation buttons appear on mouse hover.
trans-unit.target: For a mouse, navigation buttons appear on mouse hover.

trans-unit.source: For a keyboard, arrow keys move through the collection.
trans-unit.target: For a keyboard, arrow keys move through the collection.

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: FlipView class
trans-unit.target: FlipView class

trans-unit.source: ItemsSource
trans-unit.target: ItemsSource

trans-unit.source: ItemTemplate
trans-unit.target: ItemTemplate

trans-unit.source: Is this the right control?
trans-unit.target: Is this the right control?

trans-unit.source: Flip view is best for perusing images in small to medium collections (up to 25 or so items).
trans-unit.target: Flip view is best for perusing images in small to medium collections (up to 25 or so items).

trans-unit.source: Examples of such collections include items in a product details page or photos in a photo album.
trans-unit.target: Examples of such collections include items in a product details page or photos in a photo album.

trans-unit.source: Although we don't recommend flip view for most large collections, the control is common for viewing individual images in a photo album.
trans-unit.target: Although we don't recommend flip view for most large collections, the control is common for viewing individual images in a photo album.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: Horizontal browsing, starting at the left-most item and flipping right, is the typical layout for a flip view.
trans-unit.target: Horizontal browsing, starting at the left-most item and flipping right, is the typical layout for a flip view.

trans-unit.source: This layout works well in either portrait or landscape orientation on all devices:
trans-unit.target: This layout works well in either portrait or landscape orientation on all devices:

trans-unit.source: Example of horizontal flip view layout
trans-unit.target: Example of horizontal flip view layout

trans-unit.source: A flip view can also be browsed vertically:
trans-unit.target: A flip view can also be browsed vertically:

trans-unit.source: Example of vertical flip view
trans-unit.target: Example of vertical flip view

trans-unit.source: Create a flip view
trans-unit.target: Create a flip view

trans-unit.source: FlipView is an [ItemsControl](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.aspx), so it can contain a collection of items of any type.
trans-unit.target: FlipView is an [ItemsControl](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.aspx), so it can contain a collection of items of any type.

trans-unit.source: To populate the view, add items to the [**Items**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.items.aspx) collection, or set the [**ItemsSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.itemssource.aspx) property to a data source.
trans-unit.target: To populate the view, add items to the [**Items**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.items.aspx) collection, or set the [**ItemsSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.itemssource.aspx) property to a data source.

trans-unit.source: By default, a data item is displayed in the flip view as the string representation of the data object it's bound to.
trans-unit.target: By default, a data item is displayed in the flip view as the string representation of the data object it's bound to.

trans-unit.source: To specify exactly how items in the flip view are displayed, you create a [**DataTemplate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.datatemplate.aspx) to define the layout of controls used to display an individual item.
trans-unit.target: To specify exactly how items in the flip view are displayed, you create a [**DataTemplate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.datatemplate.aspx) to define the layout of controls used to display an individual item.

trans-unit.source: The controls in the layout can be bound to properties of a data object, or have content defined inline.
trans-unit.target: The controls in the layout can be bound to properties of a data object, or have content defined inline.

trans-unit.source: You assign the DataTemplate to the [**ItemTemplate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.itemtemplate.aspx) property of the FlipView.
trans-unit.target: You assign the DataTemplate to the [**ItemTemplate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.itemtemplate.aspx) property of the FlipView.

trans-unit.source: Add items to the Items collection
trans-unit.target: Add items to the Items collection

trans-unit.source: You can add items to the [**Items**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.items.aspx) collection using XAML or code.
trans-unit.target: You can add items to the [**Items**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.items.aspx) collection using XAML or code.

trans-unit.source: You typically add items this way if you have a small number of items that don't change and are easily defined in XAML, or if you generate the items in code at run time.
trans-unit.target: You typically add items this way if you have a small number of items that don't change and are easily defined in XAML, or if you generate the items in code at run time.

trans-unit.source: Here's a flip view with items defined inline.
trans-unit.target: Here's a flip view with items defined inline.

trans-unit.source: When you add items to a flip view they are automatically placed in a [**FlipViewItem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.flipviewitem.aspx) container.
trans-unit.target: When you add items to a flip view they are automatically placed in a [**FlipViewItem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.flipviewitem.aspx) container.

trans-unit.source: To change how an item is displayed you can apply a style to the item container by setting the [**ItemContainerStyle**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.itemcontainerstyle.aspx) property.
trans-unit.target: To change how an item is displayed you can apply a style to the item container by setting the [**ItemContainerStyle**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.itemcontainerstyle.aspx) property.

trans-unit.source: When you define the items in XAML, they are automatically added to the Items collection.
trans-unit.target: When you define the items in XAML, they are automatically added to the Items collection.

trans-unit.source: Set the items source
trans-unit.target: Set the items source

trans-unit.source: You typically use a flip view to display data from a source such as a database or the Internet.
trans-unit.target: You typically use a flip view to display data from a source such as a database or the Internet.

trans-unit.source: To populate a flip view from a data source, you set its [**ItemsSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.itemssource.aspx) property to a collection of data items.
trans-unit.target: To populate a flip view from a data source, you set its [**ItemsSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.itemssource.aspx) property to a collection of data items.

trans-unit.source: Here, the flip view's ItemsSource is set in code directly to an instance of a collection.
trans-unit.target: Here, the flip view's ItemsSource is set in code directly to an instance of a collection.

trans-unit.source: You can also bind the ItemsSource property to a collection in XAML.
trans-unit.target: You can also bind the ItemsSource property to a collection in XAML.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Data binding with XAML](../data-binding/data-binding-quickstart.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Data binding with XAML](../data-binding/data-binding-quickstart.md).

trans-unit.source: Here, the ItemsSource is bound to a [**CollectionViewSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.data.collectionviewsource.aspx) named `itemsViewSource`.
trans-unit.target: Here, the ItemsSource is bound to a [**CollectionViewSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.data.collectionviewsource.aspx) named `itemsViewSource`.

trans-unit.source: **Note**  You can populate a flip view either by adding items to its Items collection, or by setting its ItemsSource property, but you can't use both ways at the same time.
trans-unit.target: **Note**  You can populate a flip view either by adding items to its Items collection, or by setting its ItemsSource property, but you can't use both ways at the same time.

trans-unit.source: If you set the ItemsSource property and you add an item in XAML, the added item is ignored.
trans-unit.target: If you set the ItemsSource property and you add an item in XAML, the added item is ignored.

trans-unit.source: If you set the ItemsSource property and you add an item to the Items collection in code, an exception is thrown.
trans-unit.target: If you set the ItemsSource property and you add an item to the Items collection in code, an exception is thrown.

trans-unit.source: Specify the look of the items
trans-unit.target: Specify the look of the items

trans-unit.source: By default, a data item is displayed in the flip view as the string representation of the data object it's bound to.
trans-unit.target: By default, a data item is displayed in the flip view as the string representation of the data object it's bound to.

trans-unit.source: You typically want to show a more rich presentation of your data.
trans-unit.target: You typically want to show a more rich presentation of your data.

trans-unit.source: To specify exactly how items in the flip view are displayed, you create a [**DataTemplate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.datatemplate.aspx).
trans-unit.target: To specify exactly how items in the flip view are displayed, you create a [**DataTemplate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.datatemplate.aspx).

trans-unit.source: The XAML in the DataTemplate defines the layout and appearance of controls used to display an individual item.
trans-unit.target: The XAML in the DataTemplate defines the layout and appearance of controls used to display an individual item.

trans-unit.source: The controls in the layout can be bound to properties of a data object, or have content defined inline.
trans-unit.target: The controls in the layout can be bound to properties of a data object, or have content defined inline.

trans-unit.source: The DataTemplate is assigned to the [**ItemTemplate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.itemtemplate.aspx) property of the FlipView control.
trans-unit.target: The DataTemplate is assigned to the [**ItemTemplate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.itemtemplate.aspx) property of the FlipView control.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the ItemTemplate of a FlipView is defined inline.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the ItemTemplate of a FlipView is defined inline.

trans-unit.source: An overlay is added to the image to display the image name.
trans-unit.target: An overlay is added to the image to display the image name.

trans-unit.source: Here's what the layout defined by the data template looks like.
trans-unit.target: Here's what the layout defined by the data template looks like.

trans-unit.source: Flip view data template.
trans-unit.target: Flip view data template.

trans-unit.source: Set the orientation of the flip view
trans-unit.target: Set the orientation of the flip view

trans-unit.source: By default, the flip view flips horizontally.
trans-unit.target: By default, the flip view flips horizontally.

trans-unit.source: To make the it flip vertically, use a stack panel with a vertical orientation as the flip view's [**ItemsPanel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.itemspanel.aspx).
trans-unit.target: To make the it flip vertically, use a stack panel with a vertical orientation as the flip view's [**ItemsPanel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.itemspanel.aspx).

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to use a stack panel with a vertical orientation as the ItemsPanel of a FlipView.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to use a stack panel with a vertical orientation as the ItemsPanel of a FlipView.

trans-unit.source: Here's what the flip view looks like with a vertical orientation.
trans-unit.target: Here's what the flip view looks like with a vertical orientation.

trans-unit.source: Example of vertical flip view
trans-unit.target: Example of vertical flip view

trans-unit.source: Adding a context indicator
trans-unit.target: Adding a context indicator

trans-unit.source: A context indicator in a flip view provides a useful point of reference.
trans-unit.target: A context indicator in a flip view provides a useful point of reference.

trans-unit.source: The dots in a standard context indicator aren't interactive.
trans-unit.target: The dots in a standard context indicator aren't interactive.

trans-unit.source: As seen in this example, the best placement is usually centered and below the gallery:
trans-unit.target: As seen in this example, the best placement is usually centered and below the gallery:

trans-unit.source: Example of a page indicator
trans-unit.target: Example of a page indicator

trans-unit.source: For larger collections (10-25 items), consider using an indicator that provides more context, such as a film strip of thumbnails.
trans-unit.target: For larger collections (10-25 items), consider using an indicator that provides more context, such as a film strip of thumbnails.

trans-unit.source: Unlike a context indicator that uses simple dots, each thumbnail in the film strip shows a small version of the corresponding image and should be selectable:
trans-unit.target: Unlike a context indicator that uses simple dots, each thumbnail in the film strip shows a small version of the corresponding image and should be selectable:

trans-unit.source: Example of context indicator
trans-unit.target: Example of context indicator

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: Flip views work best for collections of up to 25 or so items.
trans-unit.target: Flip views work best for collections of up to 25 or so items.

trans-unit.source: Avoid using a flip view control for larger collections, as the repetitive motion of flipping through each item can be tedious.
trans-unit.target: Avoid using a flip view control for larger collections, as the repetitive motion of flipping through each item can be tedious.

trans-unit.source: An exception would be for photo albums, which often have hundreds or thousands of images.
trans-unit.target: An exception would be for photo albums, which often have hundreds or thousands of images.

trans-unit.source: Photo albums almost always switch to a flip view once a photo has been selected in the grid view layout.
trans-unit.target: Photo albums almost always switch to a flip view once a photo has been selected in the grid view layout.

trans-unit.source: For other large collections, consider a [List view or grid view](lists.md).
trans-unit.target: For other large collections, consider a [List view or grid view](lists.md).

trans-unit.source: For context indicators:
trans-unit.target: For context indicators:

trans-unit.source: The order of dots (or whichever visual marker you choose) works best when centered and below a horizontally-panning gallery.
trans-unit.target: The order of dots (or whichever visual marker you choose) works best when centered and below a horizontally-panning gallery.

trans-unit.source: If you want a context indicator in a vertically-panning gallery, it works best centered and to the right of the images.
trans-unit.target: If you want a context indicator in a vertically-panning gallery, it works best centered and to the right of the images.

trans-unit.source: The highlighted dot indicates the current item.
trans-unit.target: The highlighted dot indicates the current item.

trans-unit.source: Usually the highlighted dot is white and the other dots are gray.
trans-unit.target: Usually the highlighted dot is white and the other dots are gray.

trans-unit.source: The number of dots can vary, but don't have so many that the user might struggle to find his or her place - 10 dots is usually the maximum number to show.
trans-unit.target: The number of dots can vary, but don't have so many that the user might struggle to find his or her place - 10 dots is usually the maximum number to show.

trans-unit.source: Globalization and localization checklist
trans-unit.target: Globalization and localization checklist

trans-unit.source: Bi-directional considerations
trans-unit.target: Bi-directional considerations

trans-unit.source: Use standard mirroring for RTL languages.
trans-unit.target: Use standard mirroring for RTL languages.

trans-unit.source: The back and forward controls should be based on the language's direction, so for RTL languages, the right button should navigate backwards and the left button should navigate forward.
trans-unit.target: The back and forward controls should be based on the language's direction, so for RTL languages, the right button should navigate backwards and the left button should navigate forward.
